Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: MelissaEl
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect hotel for our trip to Baltimore to see the Orioles vs Yankees and other Inner Harbor sites. The hotel is so close to the stadium you can hear the annoucer calling batters to the plate!!! Buffet breakfast was fully stocked each a.m., free popcorn in afternoons, and fresh baked cookies in the evening. (24 coffee/tea in lobby as well.) Staff very friendly and rooms spacious and clean. Only downside was odd pool hours (5pm-10pm) which didn't fit into our schedule. Short walk to Inner Harbor as well. Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great for baseball”
Reviews.Author: vacation2mom
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from watching a Yankee/Orioles series. This hotel is very clean, the staff is very friendly and helpful. They have a wonderful free continental breakfast in the morning. They also had in the afternoon free popcorn, juice and sometimes fresh baked cookies in the afternoon. The pool was only open from 5-10 pm but that was ok because they had a lifeguard on duty too. This is a great hotel especially if you are coming to see a baseball game, all you do is walk across the street and into the ballpark. We could also see the Ravens stadium too from our window. I suggest that you pay to have your car keeps in the valet parking. These guys also did a great job with moving all the cars around. To get to the inner harbor you can walk its about 15 minutes or you can go around the block and take the free shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you plan on using the pool”
Reviews.Author: Yanksfan42
Reviews.Content: If you plan on going to the Orioles game and that is it this is the hotel for you. It is directly across from the stadium and right next door to a few pubs that have cheap beer and food before the game.The rooms were very clean. The downside was the pool hours during the week day are 5 pm-10pm! My kids were so looking forward to swimming before the baseball game and in the morning before check out and was unable to because of the pool hours. We went to the front desk to ask where the pool was as my kids are standing next to me in their bathing suits, they told us on the bottom floor and never mentioned the pool hours until we saw the sign on the pool door. You think he would of told us that before sending us down there. The free breakfast was not the greatest either and extremely busy,we had to bring our food up to the room to eat, there was no room to sit. If you want to see a ball game and that is it then this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Week-End”
Reviews.Author: Sherrill999
Reviews.Content: We spent St Patrick's Day week-end at the Hampton in Baltimore. The hotel was great. They upgraded our room at no extra charge. Our room over looked Camden Yards. We parked at Camden instead of using the valet parking. It was just a short walk to the hotel. We could see our car from our room.The location was great. We walked to everything. Breakfast was good. Every night they put out cookies, popcorn, and pink lemonade. It was nice coming back to a treat. I love Hampton Inn's. We plan to go back and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: hippolover
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1 night because it was across from the ballpark and 2 blocks from University of Maryland Medical School. The room was lovely - faced camden yards. We felt safe in this area and we walked to the Inner Harbor from here - about 20 minutes. Breakfast (free) in the morning was great and we saw that the lobby is a baseball field! Valet parking is expensive but so is all other parking in downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: familyprovence
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on business for four nights. Everything about the hotel was terrific. Our room was clean and orderly, as were the public areas. The room was made-up everyday and was a pleasure to return to. The location is also great. It is literally a baseball throw from Camden Yards and just down the street from the football stadium. From BWI airport you can take the light rail to the hotel, although you will have to walk about two blocks, from the Camden Yard stop or the convention center stop. It is an easy walk to get to the convention center from the hotel and the walk to the Harbor is not that far. The hotel offers a free breakfast buffet every morning, which is more than adequate. There are also a number of places for lunch and dinner right nearby, although the music can be loud - highly recommend Franks and Nicks. We found the staff extremely helpful and courteous. This hotel was a great find for value and convenience in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Road_Warrior_in_FL
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located across the road from the Ravens' stadium and the Orioles' field. We were in town on business for a trade show, but I'm guessing that if you're looking for a place to stay to attend a game at either of the stadiums, this is a very convenient spot. I can't, however, account for the noise level on a game day, as described in the other reviews. This modern hotel is also just a few blocks from the Convention Center and a reasonable walk to the Inner Harbor area, which is populated with shops, restaurants, and the impressive national aquarium. If you don't want to walk to the Inner Harbor, take the free Orange Line bus that stops in front of the Hilton Hotel, which is around the corner. We had a corner room, which had ample space. The gym is located in the basement and is well equipped with cardio equipment as welll as free weights and some weight machines. The free breakfast and free wi-fi are standard features of a Hampton Inn that make it such good value. Shower head was good but water pressure was average. The staff was friendly and the hotel was clean. We used the business center to check into our flights and print our boarding passes. The only disappointment was a lack of electrical plugs in the room to charge cell phones and laptops. The restaurants adjacent to the hotels are disappointing. They are seedy sports bars that play music so loud that you can't possibly conduct a conversation. I also question their level of hygiene. Just peeking into them was sufficient to convince us to go to the Inner Harbor for a broad selection of restaurants. I recommend eating at the Inner Harbor one night and The Circle area another. The free Orange Line bus will take you to both.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service at an immaculate hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lobos3
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at this hotel and it confirmed our choice as the place to stay in Baltimore. We received a complementary upgrade to a suite. Staff is fabulous! Easy transportation to BWI airport via Light Rail. Can also catch Amtrak at BWI. Had a scrumptious meal nearby at Frank's & Nick's Grille. Hotel amenities include free wi-fi, continental breakfast, 24 hour fitness, and indoor pool.

Reviews.Title: “Clean with friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: DreamingofHorses
Reviews.Content: Next door to Camden Yards and the Convention Center. About a 20min walk to the Inner Harbor. Our room was clean and staff very friendly. Breakfast was mobbed with people but a good selection. Parking was $29 for an overnight, which was pretty much paid for by my AAA discount.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Tanya Y
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly, the hotel was clean and they offered great continental breakfast! Even throughout the day, they had snacks such as cookies or popcorn out to munch on with a complimetnary coffee bar. I would definatly come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Helpful Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: lucyaf
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this property to attend a nearby conference at the Hilton. We had a group of 10 with 4 rooms. Our check in was flawless and all of our rooms were together as we requested. Our room with a king bed was huge and had an amazing view of home plate at Camden Yards. We enjoyed breakfast each morning, and I was very pleased at the selection. The hotel is in a great location, literally across the street from Camden Yards and within walking distance to the Inner Harbor. The front desk clerk (Friday and Saturday night) and the bellman were both so helpful to our group in suggesting restaurants, directions, etc. I would highly recommend this hotel! One note- parking is 29.00 a day. We took the light rail in from Penn Station and the station was a 3 min walk away. Very easy!

Reviews.Title: “NEW YEAR in Balitmore”
Reviews.Author: ZK1997
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Baltimore for NEW YEAR 2012. We had a great time in Hampton Inn. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The breakfast was very good. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would recommend it to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: angelambudd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to attend an event at the 1st Mariner's Center. This hotel exceeded my expectations. Very easy to get to, it is next door to Camden Yards but so are many other big hotels in the area. There is valet parking ($29, inflated for the Ravens/Texans game, I think), but is was convenient and we did not wait more than 10 min for our car. We upgraded to a bigger room and it was worth it. Granite wet bar, with fridge and micro and extra sink. Huge room with two beds and a sitting area. Sink outside of the shower/wc made getting ready very easy. The hotel was extremely clean and very new feeling. Much nicer than your average Hampton Inn. The breakfast was pretty good, again, better than average. There were a lot of people there, but it did not feel crowded. We had our 6 year old with us and did use the pool and hot tub. The pool is very small, but did the trick. The hottub was hot and clean. I would highly recommend this hotel for the price and for the location and modern feel. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, awesome location”
Reviews.Author: Marylandmama
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for an impromptu date night using hilton points. Great little hotel, we had a beautiful suite with a comfy bed, great breakfast in the morning. Very conveniently located. A gem!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you are there for Camden Yards”
Reviews.Author: bean_nj
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Baltimore. The location of this hotel is perfect if you are there for a visit to Camden Yards. In terms of visiting the Inner Harbor, it is only perfect if you plan to do a lot of walking to get there as it is located about 7 blocks (nearly a mile) from the Inner Harbor. I knew this in advance and we didn't mind the walk even though it was a bit chilly when we were there. There is the Charm City Circulator which is a free bus that picks up around the corner and will take you around Baltimore. We took it back one night and it was good since it was cold but I was a little uncomfortable in some of the areas we picked up in. Otherwise, if you don't want the walk, plan to pay for a taxi. The breakfast was fine, average and what you can expect by most Hampton Inn standards. Not quite as much variety as I have seen at other Hampton Inns and no gluten-free cereal option at breakfast which was a disappointment to my daughter. There was popcorn in the lobby in the afternoon and evening which was nice. Bottled water is cheaper out of the vending machine on the floor by your room vs the store in the lobby. There is a small indoor pool which was pretty much empty while we were there. The room we had was lovely. It was large and very clean. We was well appointed and comfortable. Our view was not so great as we overlooked a power station, but in a city sometimes you get what you get. It was better than our first room which we requested to be moved from since it was on a lower level with a view of the alley behind Pickles Pub next door. We had requested to be moved to a room in the front with a view of Camden Yards; however, they were not available as we were there the weekend of the unveiling of the Brooks Robinson statute (which is located directly in front of the hotel). In terms of restaurants, there were a few but depending on what you like there was not a tremendous variety in the immediate block; you are better off going near the Inner Harbor for a great restaurant selection. The staff was not overly helpful in this area, I asked a couple of different people for suggestions and they did not make a recommendation. When I asked about a specific restaurant I was told "sure, that would be a good option". It was a fun weekend in Baltiimore, we enjoyed the hotel and we enjoyed the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a quick overnight get-away”
Reviews.Author: KyleB813
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here when she ran in the B-more marathon. We were very impressed. The staff were all very courteous and nice, helping us with directions on several occasions. The room was quite spacious, and nicely appointed for this type of hotel. We are nonsmokers, but all that was available when we booked was a smoking room. We were especially impressed with how well they cleaned the room, as the smoke smell in the room was barely noticeable. The breakfast was great, and had a nice balance of healthy options for us. It was a 10-15 minute walk from inner harbor, and right next to Camden yards & M&T stadium. My only gripe is the parking. They were charging $26 for parking. I know this is common, but I still hate it when hotels tack on additional fees.

Reviews.Title: “worst breakfast ever”
Reviews.Author: serenecobra
Reviews.Content: This morning we went down to the breakfast area and it was poorly stocked to say the least. We stood in a long line only to find that the hot items were completely gone. What was left was merely some stale muffins and cheap danishes. Not to mention that there was no staff member there to replenish the items that were in short supply. The hotel is close to the harbor and that is the only selling factor. Definitely overpriced and not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: octob3r
Reviews.Content: This is a great location if you are there for a baseball game. Camden Yards is across the street, (do the tour of Orioles Stadium if you can, (fabulous) ask for tour guide Pete)! Very close proximity to Inner Harbor as well. The room (studio) we had for mom, dad and thee kids (9, 11 and 12) was HUGE! Two queens and a sleeper sofa, two sinks with granite (beautiful), clean and comfortable. They let us check in over 2 hours early. The pool opens at 5pm weekdays. Breakfast was excellent and even though the hotel seemed crowded, the breakfast area wasn't too crowded the morning we were there. The valets were awesome and the rest of the staff were very accommodating. The only problem we had is that both my husband and I took showers that were luke warm at best in the morning. We were there for a baseball game and the area around the hotel was like a block party atmosphere, very festive! Would absolutely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice hotel for a family!”
Reviews.Author: kfitz74
Reviews.Content: I was very happy that this hotel was so clean and nice. The theme of the hotel is baseball which was also nice because we were visiting to see a baseball game. The parking is offsite, but the valet was very nice! The breakfast with two small children under 6 was perfect too. All that one would need for two little ones! We will definitely will go back and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Better Hampton Inns”
Reviews.Author: MBPillen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a biz trip. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the rooms were spacious and clean. Best part: no crowds of families eating breakfast in the morning. Also, it was a great location for taking long walks around the Inner Harbor. Worst part: while friendly, the staff forgot to schedule my wake up call and taxi for the airport. There are several bars located adjacent to the motel, which I thought would make it noisy at night. Not at all! I loved that it was across from Camden Yards and that it was priced right. Free wifi, too!

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: lulu0510
Reviews.Content: I researched many places to stay while on our family trip to Baltimore on 8/26/11. I found this hotel which is right behind Camden yards to be in a good location and priced reasonable. The valets and hotel staff were all VERY pleasant and accomidating to us. The hotels lobby, breakfast area, pool, and room were updated and very clean and comfortable. The breakfast was more than a continental breakfast and the coffee and food were very good. The room was a good size and the bed was very comfortable. I was very pleased with the hotel and WOULD stay there again. The walk to the Inner Harbor is not too far and you can also take the free bus service there too. We had to leave a day ahead of schedule due to the hurricane and they hotel gave us no hastles about checking out and did not charge us for the extra night. Thanks Hampton Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Super Clean and Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: JARJAK
Reviews.Content: Our room was amazing - we were on the fifth floor and could see the field at Camden Yards. All we needed to do to get to an Orioles game was cross the street. Rooms were super clean, beds were amazingly comfortable. Breakfast buffet was super - they even put out cookies/brownies in the afternoon. Pool was clean and fun, too. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A++ - A Lot More Than We Expected”
Reviews.Author: Intl_Border
Reviews.Content: The hotel was super clean, the staff exceptionally helpful, and everything about our stay was top notch. I will admit that when we arrived I was uneasy about the mandatory valet parking and the apparent short supply of parking, but I needn't have been - the parking attendants took good care and there wasn't a mark on our vehicle. The hotel's location provided easy access to the free transit service throughout town - the Charm City Circulator. I can hardly wait to go back to Baltimore so that I can stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “great motel,terrible parking”
Reviews.Author: tomnov1966
Reviews.Content: next to the ballpark.good free breakfast.the valet parking is cramming 80 cars in a alley designed for 10.so,if you have a new car i wouldnt recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel..bad customer service on forgotten article”
Reviews.Author: cesartapia
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four and love baseball. We booked two rooms on July 24 at this Hampton Inn because it has a great location and is very accesible to the ballpark to see an Orioles game: just meters away. On our way back home, we noticed that my son forgot his sunglasses at his 401 room and since July 24 we tried to get in touch with someone who could help us but no answer yet, althought we place several calls to hosekeeping (no one answers); mail them fom the web page and place a complaint in a customer survey! As I said, no answers yet of any kind. Besides that, I would recommend this hotel to anyone who needs a quick access to ballpark. Clean, quiet and friendly staff at reception.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable accommodations convenient to Camden Yards”
Reviews.Author: FuryIII
Reviews.Content: During our recent road trip, the spouse had his heart set on seeing the Angels play the Orioles, and the Hampton Inn was the perfect place to stay after the game. Valet parking was a little pricey, but we were happy to let the valet have the car before we proceeded to the game. The valet/bellman couldn't have been nicer, as was the staff in general. Our double queen studio suite was very spacious, comfortable and clean. The hotel also provides a nice complimentary breakfast that had a variety of choices including eggs and bacon. A brief, but very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “All the basics. Great deal for the area. Decent location.”
Reviews.Author: tilthouse
Reviews.Content: Basic, modern, moderately priced hotel. All expectations met. Great location for Camden Yards. Good location for the Convention Center, Inner Harbor, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location to Camden Yards, Convention Center, and Waterfront.”
Reviews.Author: bsimosd
Reviews.Content: The Hampton Inn provided a good room with very good breakfasts. We walked everywhere from there, and were surprised especially by the Baltimore waterfront and seafood. The hotel staff were very friendly, and anxious to please us and answer any questions that we had about Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for Camden Yards”
Reviews.Author: RazorB
Reviews.Content: THis was an excellent hotel. Stayed in a King suite with sofa sleeper. Very large room and they accommodated request for room looking at Ballpark. Could see parts of the field through the stadium entrances and concourses. Right down the same street was Raven's football field. Check-in was courteous, efficient and quick...room was huge. Had a sink outside the bathroom which housed the tub and toilet, so your wife can work her magic while you shower, etc. Had another sink at the wetbar where you enter the room, microwave and mini-fridge. Overall a great choice for Camden yards, and close to Hilton which connected to Convention center. Hilton looked nice too, but saved money at the Hampton and free breakfast was good too. Took the Metro from BWI to Camden yards, walk by Babe Ruth statue and you are at hotel two blocks later. Will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “The second best Hampton Inn I ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: trans54
Reviews.Content: This is truly one of the best Hampton Inns I have ever stayed at. The A-C worked beautifully, which is important to me, especially when it is 95 degrees out. We did not go there for the ballgames, but you absolutely could see the field from our room. It is directly across the street from the Hotel. The self washer/dryer is COMPLIMENTARY, including the soap and dryer sheets. Will go back here every time I am in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Baseball fans: Stay here”
Reviews.Author: DenL42
Reviews.Content: If you're in Baltimore to see the O's play your favorite team, there can't possibly be a better hotel in the city than this Hampton Inn. You walk out the door, cross the street and you're at the stadium. Not only that, but the pre-game partying all takes place right outside the door. I couldn't believe how great the atmosphere was... hundreds of people just milling about hours before gametime, dozens of vendors grilling up food... the perfect environment to get pumped up for baseball (and none of the noise from below could be heard from my seventh-story room). If you like to party after the game, however, this might not be the hotel for you, as they make you sign a no-partying clause. Which is fine with me because I prefer to sleep. The room was monstrous. In fact, the beds were so far away from the TV that I could hardly see it. A 50-inch TV would be more appropriate for this space than the little flatscreen provided. The room had a small lobby with a sink, microwave and fridge, a huge sitting area with couch, two queen beds, a large closet, and a sink with a granite countertop outside the bathroom. Everything was clean and neat. The hotel has a pool and hot tub, both ridiculously small for a hotel of this size. No matter. There's also a small, private, quiet computer room in the lobby, free to use for 15 minutes at a time (or longer if no one's waiting). Breakfast is free, and it's good: Sausage, eggs and hash browns one morning; omelets and ham the next morning; and waffles, cereal, fruit, donuts, muffins and drinks every day. The employees were friendly and helpful without exception, and every one we saw said hello and asked how things were. Special consideration to the valet guy, Laban, who was extra-kind to us and even remembered what kind of car I drove. Kudos to him for dealing with the crazy parking situation here; it looks like they've got 40 cars crammed into an alley. I can only imagine the switcheroo that must take place every time someone requests their car.

Reviews.Title: “Our Savior”
Reviews.Author: CoachDub
Reviews.Content: Man, this place saved us from a bad experience at another hotel that we refused to stay. I found it on my phone, and we drove to it. The lady at the front, June, was amazing and accommodating. We were tired and frustrated with our trip to Baltimore and the poor service we had received elsewhere. The parking was pricey ($26.00 a day), but we knew where our car was and knew it was safe. June gave us all a military rate. One of the best parts, one of many, was that it was a baseball themed hotel lobby. It was dark so I did not even realize that we were across from Camden Yards! I am a baseball coach so it was great. The room was nice, the service was great, and the location was unbeatable. I could see Camden and the Ravens' stadium from my room. The breakfast was awesome and they also had 24 hour coffee and 5 o'clock hot cookies. The gym was very nice, and the indoor pool had a lifeguard, which is something I have never seen at a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bravehead
Reviews.Content: Friends and I stayed here for the U2 concert at M&T Stadium in Baltimore. PERFECT location! The stadium was an easy walk, even on a hot, summer day. Camden Yards is just across the street. Inner Harbor--about a 15 minute walk or you can take the free "Circulator" bus. The hotel was immaculate---beds were amazing--- free breakfast and cookies/lemonade put out every afternoon (nice touch for a hot summer day). There are several pubs on the same block---absolutely perfect. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because the front desk staff was slightly surly---just not very friendly or welcoming. Other than that---perfect! The only reason I didn't give this 5 stars was

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a ballgame”
Reviews.Author: DCDemTaxMan
Reviews.Content: Probably one of the best themed Hampton Inns out there. Lobby pays tribute to baseball with Camden Yards literally feet away. This is a terrific place to stay for a ballgame. Good amenities with excellent free breakfast and a uniquely situated but small pool. Parking is a challenge so best to valet for a fee. Lots of activity going on immediately outside the hotel on game nights but it was quiet from our room.

Reviews.Title: “The Best .. Loved It”
Reviews.Author: holtdmg
Reviews.Content: Stayed Memorial Day weedend 2011, 3 nights, in town for NCAA LAX .. the location couldn't have been more perfect. Being a Hilton member i try and stay at the Hampton Inn's .. and this one was as usual clean, comfy beds, good breakfast, everything you have grown to depend on with the Hilton hotels. BUT EXTRA SURPRISE, we came in late friday evening having driven in from another state about 10 ours away.. i called ahead before we left to make sure they noted late arrival, and then when we were about two hours out i called again to make sure .. we were whipped and i didn't want any hassles... when we got there they had our valet parking ready, i think i checked-in in 2 minutes, when we got to the room they had come in and turned on the air, the lights .. and rolled down the beds .. now i have never gotten that from a Hampton Inn .. the resort hiltons yes, but not the hampton.. it was so sweet and so nice and greatly appreciated ... we crashed and didn't get up until 10am .. never heard a sound.. the resturants next to hotel Pickels and Sliders were great ball park bars with good food .. Pickels was our favorite .. then about one block away was Pratt Street and the walk to Inner Harbor .. it was so much fun, we were there with 4 teenage boys for the tournament .. we felt very safe letting them go off .. and it was just lovely .. we did Cheescake Factory at Inner Harbor and Pratt Ale House outside dinning .. what they say about being able to look into the baseball stadium and see home plate from your room.. true .. and we walked less than 10 minutes to the football stadium for the games .. i will stay here when ever i am in Baltimore .. what a blast, great rate, and all the cleanliness and comforts of the Hiltons....

Reviews.Title: “If you want to have fun...look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: EZtravel15
Reviews.Content: First, upon check-in, they make you sign some disclosure about being quiet. Innocent enough, and would want a hotel to have some sort of policy with regards to noise, but I am in my thirties in town for business. After signing the disclosure the person at the check in desk followed up the signing with a 'consider it your first warning'. Kind of an insult considering I hadn't been in the hotel more than 5 minutes. The next day, I noticed employees at the desk in the lobby confronting other people staying at the hotel. The employees seemed a little aggressive towards their customers, and after the people left the hotel, I overheard a housekeeper telling the other employees that she told them 'she would have them thrown out of the hotel'. Seems like a little too much authority for a housekeeper to have!! Overall, the staff seemed eager to confront those staying there...sort of holding you prisoner of the hotel, because no one wants to deal with finding another room in a city in the middle of their trip. They seem to miss the point that they are in the hospitality industry. Next time, I pay the extra money, and stay somewhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to Baltimore Attractions”
Reviews.Author: urontv
Reviews.Content: Good hotel directly across the street from Camden Yards. Basic room with really comfortable beds. Room also has large LCD television able to hook up an external device (computer). No refrigerator or microwave in either room I stayed in. Their Internet provider is AT&T. Both times I stayed here both the wired and wireless connections were awful. Very, very slow speeds. They should not be able to call it high speed. Brought it to the hotels front desk staff both times. They should look for a different provider/have a faster connection speed for the quantity of rooms that they have. Parking is valet only. $26/day with in/out privileges. Not a big deal, because only needed my car a couple times during the stay. They have hardly any space onsite. If you don't want to valet, there is self park for $28/day at the hilton across the street. Free breakfast in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for most of the downtown events for a relatively reasonable rate”
Reviews.Author: Christian B
Reviews.Content: Very large rooms, clean, surprisingly quiet considering its location. Breakfast was above average but not outstanding. Employees seemed happy and were helpful. Adequate exercise facilities, nice pool and hot tub both on the basement level. Remember to take into account the nightly parking fee... currently 26 per night... Valet only

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, extraordinary staff”
Reviews.Author: emetplay
Reviews.Content: Everything was outstanding-friendly, helpful staff, quiet, clean and, well equipped room The breakfast was inadequate

Reviews.Title: “What a treat to be able to stay at such a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: catslmd
Reviews.Content: I booked 10 rooms because our FIRST Robotics Team 1699 was competing at the Baltimore Convention Center. The convention center was about 2 blocks away from the hotel, so it was very convent. We had 14 students, 4 junior mentors(students that had graduated but came to help us out and cheer us on), and 7 mentors. Our rooms were spacious with queen size beds. Everything was spotless. Ladies you know how hard it is to keep snow white white. In this hotel they had snow white coverlets on all the quilts, and they were snow white. There wasn't a spot on any of them. The rest of the hotel was just as clean. Every morning we had a hot breakfast that was served from 6:00 am to 10:00 am. These breakfasts consisted of eggs and either a sausage, ham, canadian bacon or bacon and some kind of home fries. There was also the choice of fresh fruits, dry cereal, donuts, muffins, bagels, coffees, teas, juices, and milks. Some of our students had birthdays, so I brought cupcakes and frosting to celebrate. We did not eat all of them, so the put the frosting in the hotel refrigerator so we could use it the next day. Two days before we arrived it occured to me that we had some students that were allergic to feathers. This hotel had feather pillows and quilts. I caled and requested that 5 of the rooms not have feathers. They were not sure who would get what room, so they took them out of all the rooms, and anyone who wanted feathers could just ask and they could get them. We spent most of our time at the convention center and Inner Harbor, which is about 2 blocks from the convention center. We went to the Aquarium and several restaurants, and a few of the mall shops. We had a great time and we won the regional. I can not say enough good things about this hotel. They bend over backwords to make everything you want and need happen.

Reviews.Title: “So friendly and helpful! Comfortable and convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: cooperswalker
Reviews.Content: Granted us an early check in after relocating from another hotel that was having heating/cooling problems. Fresh, clean, brightly decorated with comfortable furnishings...cool baseball glove chair in the lobby! Breakfast very conveniently arranged - not stumbling over other diners for service...lots of seating in breakfast area. Very efficient staff in breakfast area. Parking attendants are prompt and so pleasant! Smiles all around, helpful loading and unloading luggage and offering directions around town. Room was quiet, comfortable and spacious. Pool/ hot tub area was beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place To Stay Near Camden Yards”
Reviews.Author: Sliphorn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton as it was near the Babe Ruth Museum (a very easy walk). It had the usual good Hampton amenities and appearance. The staff was excellent and very helpful. Check in and out were a breeze. We requested a quiet location and were put on the top floor (8th). It was quiet and we slept well. Breakfast had all the usual items and I enjoyed the waffle I made. Cars were valeted ($26!) and were right by the door so getting it brought up was quick. I had had a car warning light for tire pressure come on and both valets directed me across the street to the gas station that had a tire pump. My wife had nausea issues and the front clerk gave me Pepto Bismal to give her. It was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: cutesister
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton the first weekend of October to see the last of the Orioles games. Hotel is literally across the street and such a close walk. Not far from M & T stadium either. The rooms were very clean and spacious. We stood in a suite with 2 double beds and a pull out sofabed. Staff was very friendly and lobby has complimentary coffee and in the morning complimentary breakfast which included, cereals, yogurt, fresh fruit, bagels, toast, danish, muffins, juice, coffee, milk and even belgium waffles. Wow! I was very impressed with their breakfast since the last hotel we stood at we had to pay $15 a person for almost the same breakfast. I would recommend this hotel as a must if you are visiting Baltimore area.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshingly Nice”
Reviews.Author: JacksBack05101
Reviews.Content: Entrance is smallish across the street from Camden Yards, but when you enter, it is nice. Complimentary coffee and ice water 24/7. Free USA Today paper. The desk staff is friendly and they have a mini-store with snacks and sundries open 24/7 too. Hot Breakfast and make your own waffles. 3 kinds of coffee cream. Rooms are spacious and clean. Floor to ceiling glass showers. Indoor pool, hot tub and gym. Onsite taxi man is awesome and will take you anywhere. Walking distance to Convention Center, & M&T Stadium where the Ravens play. Pickles pub next door is a dive, you are better off at Sliders right next to Pickles, where the locals go and it's cleaner and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for Baseball/Football/Inner Harbor adventures”
Reviews.Author: edgailb
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly & helpful upon check-in and throughout our stay. The room was a pleasant surprise- nicely appointed, spacious, great bed(my husband & I both have bad backs) with very comfortable bedding... Very nice fitness center and pool with jacuzzi. The complimentary breakfasts were excellent! The location was within walking distance of Camden Yards, and easily accessible to the football stadium as well. Inner Harbor was about 6 blocks away. We travelled from NJ via Amtrak and took the light rail to within 1 1/2 blocks of the hotel. Very convenient. If we were to have driven, the parking would have been a very expensive issue. All-in-all excellent week-end getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: jonkarNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Hotel wasvery busy..... fully booked,but service wasstill great......staff friendly and very helpfull. Very good breakfast(included) and always a late afternoon snack. Clean....nice outdoor patio area. Right next to ballpark and a short walk to football stadium and Inner harbor. This hotel met or exceeded all expectations at a very reasonable price. Have booked another stay in November.

Reviews.Title: “Unique location, excellent choice for business”
Reviews.Author: EasyGoer89
Reviews.Content: Happened to pick this spot on a non-Orioles night...Camden Yards is across the street. The hotel is in the upper echelon of Hampton Inns. Location is fun - multiple bars/restaurants within walking distance and very cheap on non-game days. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I could see home plate from my hotel room”
Reviews.Author: stroudcrowd
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Baltimore for one night to catch an Orioles game. We were in room 501 which is on the far right corner if you are looking at the front of the hotel. When we checked in I truly began to realize exactly how close we were to the ballpark. I could actually see home plate from my hotel room. You wouldn't be able to watch the game from there but it is an excellent place to stay if you are in town for a game or convention. We were in easy walking distance from the inner harbor and was able to see some of the sites before going to the game. The pre and post game activities in front of the hotel are great. Boston was in town so there were alot of fans out enjoying the bars and the food vendors. You can take food into the ballpark but no alcohol from what I understand. Breakfast is your standard continental breakfast (nothing special but nothing bad either).

Reviews.Title: “Above average stay”
Reviews.Author: Traverseforfun
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room, comfortable bed, clean, quiet, great view. The only thing missing was a refrigerator in the room. The pool is also really small. Good exercise room, though. If you want to go to a baseball game, it is literally across the street from the stadium. However, if you want to ignore that it's there, you won't hear it and it won't bother you. The price was better than most other hotels for what you got for it.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints.”
Reviews.Author: SciGuyMrD
Reviews.Content: The long and short: • 15 minute walk to Inner Harbor fun. • $26/ day parking • Walk out of hotel and right into Oriole Park fun -- literally steps to park • Clean, good service, basic room • Better than average breakfast -- fresh fruit salad, waffles, bacon, scrambled eggs, above-average coffee • Decent, albeit small, pool and fitness center although sign says pool doesn't open until 5 p.m. on weekdays -- don't know if that is accurate • Would definitely recommend although at $189 a night + parking I would consider it an "excellent" value

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: nymx5793
Reviews.Content: The Hampton Inn at Camden Yards was awesome. We stayed here to visit Camden Yards and see Orioles games, and also to visit the Baltimore Inner Harbor area. The hotel was very very clean. The lobby area was nice (baseball themed.) There is a very good breakfast every morning. It includes bagels, pastries, english muffins, yogurt, cereal, waffles, and three hot items. (Hot items ranged from home fries, omelettes, porked ham, bacon, and bagel toppers during our stay.) There is also juice and coffee. In addition it seemed that the hotel provided cookies and baked goods at night which was nice. The room was VERY spacious. We had a two bed studio. There was so much room. It had a fridge, microwave, desk, and a pullout couch (but don't count on the couch for a very good sleep. The person who slept on it said it was not comfortable at all.) The beds were comfy, and the bathroom and the vanity area were clean. The pool is small, but it's nice. There is also a jacuzzi. In addition, there is a lifeguard on duty at all times. There is also a fitness area and a laundry area. I also used the business center, but if your counting on the computer to send business reports or something along those lines, I would be careful. The computer was sort of slow and very inconsistent. The walk to Camden Yards is literally 30 seconds across the street. Right next to the hotel is Pickles Pub. The pub puts up tents and has a big bbq before every home game. The crowd is nice but they are loud. Camden Yards is amazing, I suggest you take the tour as well. Orioles.com has more info on the ballpark tour. We visited the inner harbor area for the afternoon. It's very nice. We went to the Maryland Science Center. While nice, it's definitely geared towards younger children. (Tip: The lifeguard gave us very good words of wisdom. When you step out the hotel main lobby door, go the left, NOT to the right. The neighborhood to the right of the hotel is not so good. To the left, (towards Pickles Pub, etc.) is nice.) There is a $26 a night valet. There is basically nowhere to park in Baltimore. Keep in mind that your vehicle will likely be parked offsite a few blocks away. Remember to take your belongings, but if you forgot something the hotel will send someone to go get your stuff. Also, you need to call the lobby 15 minutes prior to getting your vehicle, so keep that in mind when planning your day. In all honestly it does not make sense to shell out extra bucks to stay at the Hilton or Marriot in this area. The Hampton Inn @ Camden Yards was super clean, modern, and everything seemed very new. The location across from the ballpark could not be beat. Have a great time, and if you have any questions about the hotel feel free to send me a message and I'll try to answer it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: FindYourPassion
Reviews.Content: Check in went smooth; staff was helpful. Hotel looked new. Parking fee of $26, but it was reasonable compared to other hotels in the area. Top floor facing front of hotel, 2 Queen beds was perfect - quiet, very clean (and I am extremely picky). Beds were very comfortable and no problems with adjusting a/c in hotel room. Our stay was on a Wed. night so maybe the bar/restaurant next door could be noisy on the weekend, but we never heard any noise. Theme of hotel is baseball being across the street from Camden Yards - tastefully done. Lower level had nice pool, fitness area, laundry (I think it was complimentary-soap, etc.) Complimentary breakfast was nice-they did a nice job keeping it replenished and clean. Small business center was nice. Close to Inner Harbor -walking distance 10 min away. Felt very safe walking to the harbor. Hop, Skip, and a Jump to Convention Center. Had dinner at Moe's in the Italian section of town and took the restaurant's free shuttle back to hotel ($10 tip for 3 people). Would definately recommend and would stay here again if I was in the area.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous room ... huge!”
Reviews.Author: da_jm
Reviews.Content: recently spent a quick overnight here and would return without hesitation. our room on the 8th floor was enormous .. king studio overlooking the stadium with a wet bar/refrigerator/microwave, pullout couch and flat screen tv. the location can't be beat as it's right across the street from the ballpark and with breakfast included (and an indoor pool!), you really can't go wrong. very clean, perfect location, highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for Baseball.”
Reviews.Author: Foreman212
Reviews.Content: We drove up from N. Virginia and decided to attend an Orioles game for Saturday Night and then Sunday afternoon. The hotel is right across the street from the park and on the same block as two bars for some post game brews. The room was nice and the staff was great. We checked out and were able to check our bag and leave our car there without having to move to a differant garage and pay again for parking. Great decor in the hotel and overall a very good stay. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our stay”
Reviews.Author: tblakl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights with a group of high school kids for a convention. The location was within walking distance of the convention center and the inner harbor. Rooms were clean and beds were comfortable. Breakfast was also great each morning. The high-speed interent was finicky, but they also had a business room with a computer and printer, so we could print boarding passes. Walked right across the streen to go to an Orioles game.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Baseball Roadtrip”
Reviews.Author: tojo72
Reviews.Content: New hotel,fresh roomy rooms,very comfortable,across from ballpark,some noise but reasonably quiet,staff was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Baseball Game with Family”
Reviews.Author: ssfer
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at a Hampton Inn. We are more a Westin/Sheraton family. This hotel has a great location across from Camden Yards and a nice walk to the Harbor. Breakfast buffet was sufficient and included in the price. Bathroom was big enough to have 2 people using at same time. Staff was friendly and accomodating. Easy to get to from the airport. Very boisterous nightlife in front of the hotel at night, but our room didn't face it, so no noise problems. As an aside: we did a van service online prior to the trip, vanandlimo.com, which was great. A little history lesson with our ride in.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in Downtown Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: polin001
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a welcome respite from the hustle and bustle of downtown Baltimore. Conveniently located near the convention center and Orioles Park, the hotel is new and the rooms are very comfortable and cozy. The bed was amazing. I had one of the best nights sleep in a long time. The service is friendly and efficient. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Being next to Camden Yards, it was noisy...”
Reviews.Author: 1Lightfoot1
Reviews.Content: Being next to Camden Yards, it was noisy at night with music from the bar next to the hotel. Some of the hotel staff were friendly, but one receptionist was rude. She wasn't friendly at all when we checked in and when I asked her if she knew what rime one of the museums opened, not only was she unhelpful and curt with her reply but she gave me the wrong time. She did qualify her answer by saying she didn't know but I expect a hotel receptionist to be more helpful in assisting a guest find simple information about local attractions. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone unless you're familiar with the city and you're only here to catch a baseball game.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate hotel with excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: lobos3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn Baltimore Downtown Convention Center near Camden Yards stadium for 3 nights. The hotel is located directly across from the baseball stadium and within walking distance of the Light Rail, an inexpensive transportation alternative from BWI. The hotel is immaculate and the staff was very friendly. June, a manager, was especially kind to us in helping us to navigate the public transportation system. A free breakfast buffet, with various rolls, juices, cereals, waffles, yogurts, fresh fruits, eggs, and sausages, is available to all guests. Additionally, the hotel has free internet service as well as a cookie/coffee/tea bar that is open for 24 hours. We will stay again at this lovely hotel and we would highly recommend it to travelers to Baltimore. Additionally, if a traveler wishes to visit Washington, DC, and doesn't have a car, there are several options provided by MTA and Amtrak.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!”
Reviews.Author: OHTrip
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel once again to visit my daughter who is a MICA student. Getting around is so easy with the proximity to the light rail and inner harbor. The new "clean green" commuter bus can take you all the way down Pratt Street to the Harbor East area...for free! This makes it simple to walk to Fells Point and Little Italy. In short, this Hampton Inn offers a great value, great service, wonderful location, and the ability to get around without a car. From what we hear, the bus will have two additional lines in the spring, allowing Baltimore visitors and citizens more options for getting around the city. Even though there was still plenty of snow from the historic blizzards of 2010, we had a wonderful visit. Everyone we met was genuine kind and considerate. No wonder they call Baltimore "charm city".

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Clean, and Good Service and Affordable!”
Reviews.Author: rocksballer13
Reviews.Content: I was part of a group of football coaches in Baltimore for a clinic......my wife picked this hotel for the price, proximity to the meeting, and the amenities that were included! We were (8 of us) very pleased. The fitness room was nice and whirlpool very clean. The beds are probably the most comfortable i have slept in on a trip away from home. The breakfast buffet was top notch and coffee/tea/fresh hot cookies/fruit available as we got back in the late afternoon was a an UNEXPECTED SURPRISE!. Close to 2 friendly neighborhood pubs, and Camden Yards is right across the street. I will use this hotel on all future trips!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: koalabear33
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hampton Inn Camden Yards on a recent trip to visit my niece at college. Although there are many choices of hotels in the area I chose Hampton Inn because my excellent experience at other Hampton locations and am glad I did. The staff was wonderful! Friendly, attentive and efficient at all times and in all areas. Rooms were clean and comfortable, as was the lobby seating area and breakfast room (due in no small part to Jamar the lounge room attendant) Lakisha at the front desk was helpful, patient and friendly, as were the housekeeping staff I met. We did not have a car but the valets were very present and attentive at the door It is a wonderful location...close to the Light Rail service and walking distance to Inner Harbor. And of course,,is across the street from Camden Yards. I highly recommend this hotel and commend the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not much within walking distance”
Reviews.Author: towner8
Reviews.Content: Camden Yards is right across the street, but restaurants and not within close walking distance. Staff is friendly and helpful. Small rooms. Be prepared to pay $26 for valet parking- per day.

Reviews.Title: “If you are a baseball fan-This is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Zebra11
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a really good hotel. It is clean, and the baseball decor is very inviting. If you want to enjoy an Orioles game and spend some free time at the Inner Harbor, you can't beat this hotel. The staff is very courteous and friendly. Our room was very clean and had a great view of the ballpark. The valet parking is very convenient; and considering we were going to the game the evening of our stay and the following afternoon, it was somewhat reasonable in price. The valet had our car parked right out in front of the hotel and ready to go for us immediately after the end of the afternoon game. We were on our way within 5 minutes of walking out of the ballpark. You are charged an extra $15 if you leave your car after the check-out time of noon. If you don't care to be around families and kids that enjoy baseball, you may want to consider another hotel. We would definitely stay here again the next time that we visit Baltimore and plan to take in an Orioles game.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the walk!”
Reviews.Author: donmarNorthHaven
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed one night on our way back from Washington D.C. and had a wonderful experience with the hotel and Baltimore in general. Our main purpose of our stay in Baltimore was to see Camden Yards and watch the Orioles. We really loved the fact that we had a room (as I requested ) on the 8th floor with a view of Camden Yards and nothing beats being able to walk back to the hotel after a long game. Our room was clean with nice beds, comfortable pillows and a good sized bathroom. The staff was extremely accomidating and could not have been nicer. We are walkers so we had no problem with the 15 minute walk to the Inner Harbor which is beautiful and well worth seeing even if you are there just for a game. I will definetely stay at this hotel again. Great value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Better than excellent service”
Reviews.Author: jenoro
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hampton Inn July 2009 to attend a ball game. From the second we arrived, we were treated like VIP's. We arrived at 10am and wanted to store our bags, as we were going to and afternoon baseball game. The front desk was extremely busy, guests checking out, guests arriving and the phone ringing off the hook. There was one person at the desk, all the others were in a meeting. I think the gentleman's name was Wayne. He was fabulous. He kept his cool, and somehow made ever one feel like they were first in line. He told us he had no storage left for our luggage, but motioned to me to "wait a minute" while he juggled 3 other phone calls. He got off the phone to tell me, much to my surprise, that he had a room for us.....at 10:00 am and we could check in!! This man deserves an award!!! The room was great..... clean, comfortable, modern and extremely quiet. We could actually see the pitchers mound at Camden Yards from our room!! Went to the game, literally a 30 second walk from the front door of the hotel, and came back to use the pool. I guess the size of the pool would be the only negative at this hotel, but it was fine for the kids. Went to the front desk for dinner suggestions and again we were given more help than we could have ever imagined. This staff REALLY CARES about their guests. We walked to the inner harbor for dinner and ended up in little Italy. This is about a 10-15 minute walk from the hotel. It's not far at all. We were approached by several panhandlers on the way but never felt unsafe. They were actually funny and entertaining, believe it or not! The breakfast, before we checked out was very good. Even the valet staff had our car ready and pointed in the right direction for us to hop right in and leave....even though we didn't want to. I would stay nowhere else if returning to Baltimore in the future. The staff and management at this hotel are first class!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel for game and sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: chrstn
Reviews.Content: LOVED this place. The staff was very friendly and gave us excellent advice/inside scoop on Camden Yards vs. the "block party" food right outside the hotel - go for the grilled food there - just as good and 1/3 of the price as stadium. Would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Hampton Inn...a grand slam!”
Reviews.Author: Watthree
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at the Hampton Inn across from Camden Yards when I was in town for a baseball game and found this to be a terrific location. Staff: Valet and Check-in staff were great. Very friendly and informative and they were nice even though I was coming to see the team that was playing the Orioles! Facilities: The hotel looks fairly new and it is well maintained. The hallways and common areas are spotless. The gym and pool area is in the basement, but it’s very nice. I didn’t use the pool but saw families using it while I was on the treadmill. The room was nicely decorated and very comfortable. Highlights: If you are in town for an Orioles game, you can’t get any closer than this. The hotel is right across the street from the stadium. Additionally, they close off the street in front of the hotel before the game and the bars next door take over the street, so before and after the game, it is like a beer garden. Even though my team (the Mets) lost, had a great time hanging out in front of Pickle’s Pub after the game. Areas for improvement: This is a very nice downtown hotel. Its costs are comparable to other hotels, but you also get a free breakfast and free internet. The location is great for both the Orioles, the Babe Ruth museum and the Inner Harbor is a brief walk. The curtains could be a little darker as some lights from the street got in, but otherwise, no suggestions for improvement. Overall impression: Liked the staff, the location and the facilities very much. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have stayed at !!!!”
Reviews.Author: corkey9663
Reviews.Content: Very clean room. Great bed,, pillows to soft, Nice bathroom, Flat screen TV with cable, Free wireless internet, This hotel is right across the street from the ball park, and waliking distance to everything, it was great. The staff was very very friendly

Reviews.Title: “Literally steps from Camden Yards!”
Reviews.Author: richjack
Reviews.Content: I didn't even know you could get a hotel room this close to any stadium anywhere! LOL It is just accross the street. The hotel is great, nothing lacking at all and like I said the location is unbelievable for a baseball game. And only a few blocks from the football stadium so it would work for that also.

Reviews.Title: “prime lodging for Camden Yards”
Reviews.Author: tymelyron
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hampton Inn Camden Yards for the opening day Orioles/Yankees game earlier this month. I had gotten an email in advance with special directions/parking information in light of street closures in connection with the game, which was a big help. As we got closer to the hotel from the highway, it looked like there would be no way to get through, but, just as the directions said, we were able to get past the barriers and throngs of fans there for the game and pull right up to the hotel. The staff of the hotel was most helpful in allowing us in and then parking the car to let us check in. The hotel is right across from the ballpark and our room overlooked the stadium, though the building is not high enough to see the field (which the Hilton Inn next door would be able to do). Even though the room was that close to the crowds below, the noise level was not a problem. The hotel still looks new, and the room was clean and good sized, with comfortable beds and especially good pillows. Free breakfast the next morning was great, fresh food and even with a self-service waffle maker. The ability to get to/from I-95 is a plus, as the hotel is only 2 blocks from the entrance/exit ramp and easy to access. Walking to the Inner Harbor is a bit far, especially in cold or rainy weather, but probably a pleasant (15 minute or so) walk when it is nice out. Given reasonable room rates, this hotel is a keeper.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough but I'd probably go elsewhere if I went again”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl88
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for it's price and proximity to Camden Yards. We planned to arrive in Baltimore about an hour before the afternoon game we were attending. I wanted to park at the hotel and walk over (literally across the street). Because the street was blocked we were unable to pull into the hotel. We had to pay to park in the stadium parking. Then a nightmare to get back around to the hotel and then pay again to park there. If there's a game that day - beware! Roads are closed, you have to go blocks out of the way to get there. The hotel lobby is very nice inside, quite new, a little cramped as the place is built on a postage stamp. The staff was nice. Our room was nice, good size, a king bed and a pull out couch. But no refrigerator. I really would expect a fridge at this price/hotel level. A big inconvenience for us. I looked out the window, we were on the sixth floor in the back. Immediately I could already predict a 6am wakeup call from the garbage haulers. And I was right - 6am Friday and 6:30am Saturday. After which the kids were up for the day. It's not that close to the Inner Harbor - walkable, but not close. Having already lost out on our reason for staying there in the first place - the proximity to the game - something closer to the Harbor would have been more convenient. It was only a few blocks from the B&O Railroad Museum (other direction from Inner Harbor) so that was an easy walk. Overall, if I couldn't find anything for near the price I might stay again, but otherwise I would go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Championship Hotel”
Reviews.Author: andrew11
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at this Hampton to attend a Yankees/Orioles game and I cannot imagine a better place to stay for a game. Just a few hours before game time, and just a few steps out of the hotel's doors, many vendors set up and cook some delectable grilled hamburgers, hot dogs, sauasge, etc. It smells so.....baseballgamish. Great atmosphere for a baseball fan. The Inner Harbor is a bit of a hike but, as has been mentioned, very doable. Even closer, only a block and a 3 minute walk from this Hampton, is the Babe Ruth Museum. It's the birthplace of the Babe and is well worth a visit for baseball fans. The $26 valet was nice but I did deduct a point for having some of my SUV settings changed (seat and mirrors). Maybe it was to care better for my vehicle, but if possible, just leave them alone, please. The breakfast was very good with hot sausge and sausage and gravy. The room was very clean and nice. Beds were comfortable. Overall, immaculate really. If you're doing a Orioles game, there might be a hotel AS good as this one, but there will not be one BETTER. It can't be beat for that. It's worth so much just to be able to walk right out of the ballpark and into the hotel after the game. One warning about the crowd we encountered at the game (and can be said for just about every ballpark I've been to except Fenway Park): there will be loud, oboxious, unlearned Oriole fans there. Throw in a few Budweisers and, if they haven't already, your children will be introduced to explectives after explectives. To be honest, idoits! Not near as funny as they think and really should keep their mouth shut if they no nothing about ballgames. I just can't see me going to the opera (no thanks, I'm sorry) and spouting off explectives for all to hear about how terrible the tenor was. They've got them everywhere I guess. Oh, and this would be an excellent hotel for Ravens games also. Their stadium is within site but not near as close as Camden Yards.

Reviews.Title: “A Home Run!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: newjerseyfamily
Reviews.Content: This hotel is now our favorite place to stay in Baltimore. We found the hotel easily with their directions, and met with the very personable valet staff. The front desk staff were equally impressive. We found our room to be large, with plenty of drawer space if you needed it, and well appointed with a big oversized chair, desk and two additional chairs. We had a view of both stadiums from our room. My son was delighted with the large selection of TV channels on the new flat screen TV. The gym looked great, though we didn't use it on this stay as we were there for just one night. The pool needed the chlorine to be adjusted and was being worked on by an attendant, so we just used the hot tub. The hot tub might be the only negative - it had only two jets, one seemed to bubble water out onto the floor, and the bottom of the tub didn't look appealing - I suspect the paint was wearing off. The water was fine, if not a little too hot. As we were visiting a relative who works for the University of Maryland, we could not have stayed any closer - it was about a block and a half away. The walk to the Inner Harbor, inspite of some freezing temperatures, was quite doable, and we felt very safe. Breakfast was great, well stocked, well organized, and very well done. This really is THE place to stay if your attending a game, but I'd also recomend it as a great place to stay if your visiting Baltimore at all. Easy access to 95 if your traveling. For the price, this place was perfect, a definite home run.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for a Hampton Inn Hotel”
Reviews.Author: caneshockey31
Reviews.Content: When i arrived at the hotel around 12pm I noticed my name at the Front Desk: I happened to be the "Guest of the Day" I received a free movie rental for my one-night stay, some water, some cookies, chips & some little squishy balls (baseball, football, golf ball with the hotel logo and such) The room on the six floor was excellent. Had a great view of Camden Yards and the room was very big with a kitchen right when you walked into the room. I was thoroughly impressed with this Hampton, this is one of the better ones that I've stayed at in a long time. All the staff in the hotel were great, and very warm and helpful. I would stay here again if i am traveling through this area. Info: Inner Harbor (Seven Blocks) 15 min walk Camden Yards (no blocks) 30 sec walk to Camden St Entrance If taking the Light Rail (Get off at Convention Center Station and walk straight up 2 blocks to the hotel) It is behind the new Hilton Baltimore. Airport is about 5 miles a way, train station is a 15 min train ride to the Convention Center station. Nice big breakfast area with big screen television in the breakfast room (had seating for both indoors and outdoors)

Reviews.Title: “We Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Damaskfan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is over the road from the ballpark and within easy walking distance from the harbour front area. The staff were friendly and helpful, the breakfast was great and the constant supply of hot coffee was a real bonus. Our room was large and very clean. There is free internet access if you need it. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “SHOULD BE A 5 STAR- Best hotel experience in a long time”
Reviews.Author: aubietiger99
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The staff go over and beyond to make you feel welcome and comfortable. Some examples: if a staff person sees you coming towards an elevator they press the button so when you arrive at the elevator it is waiting on you. They always ask to give you directions and constantly wish you a good day or good evening. The valet are particularly helpful and always ask can they give you directions or help you get somewhere. The cleaning staff speak to you and welcome and say "Have a good day." They are real sticklers about keeping their hotel spotless; the housekeeper on the 8th floor where I stayed was even dusting the glass on the table by the elevator and the windows to the vending machine room and each time she saw me she asked was everything ok or could she get me anything. Every staff member I encountered from the women and men at the front desk, the lady who takes care of the breakfast each morning, the men and women of the valet staff, as well as the maintenance and all the housekeeping are all the nicest and most helpful people I have encountered at a hotel in a very very long time. They all went out of their way to make sure everyone had an excellent stay. Thank you all for a wonderful stay. If there is an award for this hotel chain this group should win. Excellent view of Camden Yards and in close proximity to many things downtown including the Inner Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: enr521
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night over labor day as we were visiting the Balitmore Antique Show. After a lot of research on this website, we decided to stay at the Hampton Inn Camden Yards and what a pleasant surprise, especially since I look for things to be wrong. We got to Baltimore early (11:00am) and the hotel let us check right in. Our room was very spacious, clean, recently updated and comfortable. We didn't make a dinner reservation but Dorian, the friendliest and hardest working front desk man, was happy to make some suggestions and show us menus. We ended up going to Obrycki's for crabs. Having eaten crabs from the time I was 4, I wasn't very impressed, if I were you, try somewhere else. When we returned from dinner Dorian was there to greet us with a smile and asked how dinner was. In the morning we took advantage of the free breakfast which was adequate with coffee, juice, muffins, bagels, eggs, yogurt, cereal and fruit. It wasn't the best breakfast ever (we're breakfast snobs), but if you have children and don't feel like spending more money, this is perfect. Check out was a breeze as Dorian was still there! When does this guy sleep? I read some reviews where the valet was slow but they brought our car around in under 5 minutes. From the hotel we went over to Fells Point for some shopping and afternoon bar hopping. We are planning a return trip to Baltimore and will most definately stay at the Hampton Inn! We usually stay in 4 star hotels but we find absolutely no reason to spend the extra money when the Hampton Inn is such a nice hotel and such a great value for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location, but book early for key weekends”
Reviews.Author: marybcole
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of our 10-day Baseball Road Trip. The location of this hotel is perfect if you are in town for a game – it’s a one minute walk to the stadium. Rooms were very nice and a so-so breakfast is included – adequate, but nothing special. When we made our reservation, the 2-queen-bed rooms were sold out, so we got a king w/ rollaway bed. The rollaway was a bit short for my son who is 12, but already 5’10”. Our room looked out on an alley way and brick buildings, but I think the other rooms look out toward the stadium. View and access to sunlight would be better there. One word of caution is that there are eateries and bars next to the hotel that party-on after a game (nothing seedy, but potentially noisy), so it could be loud on the stadium side. Ask the hotel or read other reviews on this. The hotel has a small pool, and even though some folks said it had limited hours, we could swim from 9AM to 10PM. It’s a basement pool, so no view to the outside, but it was good for a quick dip once or twice a day. I am sure this is not as swanky as other hotels that are $400+, but those were not in our budget and we hardly spent any time in the room. We very much enjoyed our stay here and would certainly come back. Book early! One last word on finding the hotel. We came down Green St and attempted to turn left on Washington Blvd in front of the hotel. It seemed like Washington Blvd was a one way street, so we kept going and circled all over the place. Called hotel and they encouraged us to just bully our way on to Washington Blvd, even though there were lots of cars and trucks parked there on game day. They were right! We made the turn successfully. You may have to hop out and find the valet since it’s really crowded in front of the hotel. Also, request car well in advance to get it out of valet parking on a game day. Ours took about 20 mins, so just plan ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: emdpetey
Reviews.Content: Instead of driving down to Baltimore to attend a convention center event as we usually do every year, we decided to take a train. Seeing this hotel was close to everything I wanted to see (convention center - 2 blocks, Camden Yards across the street, inner harbor - 15 minute walk) I booked it for a 1 weekday night in July. I took the light train from Baltimore Penn Station to the convention center stop. From here it was only a 2 block walk to the hotel using West Camden St. Upon check in we were given a room on the 3rd floor overlooking Camden Yards. The room was extremely clean with a flat screen tv, comfortable beds, and a great shower. Downstairs they have a gym with a few elliptical machines,treadmills and a weight station. In the morning the hotel offers a continental breakfast which I thought was pretty good. They had your normal muffins, bagels, yogurts, fruit, juices, all which tasted very fresh. After check out, the hotel front desk held our bags for us until we came back later in the day. All in all it was a very nice clean hotel with good service. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Started Poorly - Ended Very Nicely”
Reviews.Author: Robert_Greene
Reviews.Content: We were staying at this Hampton for the same reason most everyone else does, a Baltimore Orioles game. When we arrived at 4pm (game time 7pm that night) we found the lobby mobbed with folks checking in. Waited about 15 minutes which wasn't so bad until the front desk person notified us that the 2 Bed Queen Suite (with micro/fridge) we booked was not available. When I asked why, I was told someone had "stayed over" which should not have happened when we had the room reserved and paid for that night. I asked for and spoke with the manager on duty and she tried to help by checking what was available. First she asked of we would accept two single rooms (at the price we paid for the suite) and Isaid that would be fine if they were connecting or even next to each other. She thought she found one and we said great, but then she found that one room was on 5th floor and the other on 3rd and that would not work for us. She went back to looking for a room and finally said, I;m sorry but it appears the ONLY non-smoking room we have is a one bed King room, no sofa bed. She asked if that would work and I said, not really since it was my wife, me and two boys. Now it is 530 and nearly time to get ready for the game so we could not really go find anything else, so I said we would take the room but for all our trouble, how about a reduced rate? She asked what would make me happy? I replied, I would have been hapy with the room we reserved and paid for and could accept the room at a reduced rate but was not "happy" about it and would not return again to this hotel. (We usually stay at Courtyard Marriotts or Residence Inns and have NEVER had a problem like this). she still pressed on about what price would make me happy for the room and I said, Well, FREE would make me happy and she said OK you got it. Needless to say I was surprised as well as being "happy" with a free room. After all, they did waste about an hour and a half of our time anyway. The rest of the stay was great. Room was very comfortable (except for the boys sleeping on the floor). We will probably give them another try simply because the Manager went out of her way to "satisfy" the customer.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Results - Overall Fine”
Reviews.Author: Redd_Dogg
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I'm an "easy traveler"... not too picky... My family (me, my wife, and two teen sons) were staying over a long weekend in Baltimore with the Orioles and the Inner Harbor as centerpieces. Overall, I stay was worth it and pleasant. However, we had mixed feelings about the hotel itself. PRO: LOCATION - The location next to Camden Yards makes it perfect for a stay. If that is your goal, stay there. But also know that there are several other hotels there or being built. PRO: CLEANLINESS - The hotel was very clean and well-maintained. PRO: LAUNDRY - There was a free laundry next to the workout gym and pool. For a famiiy in the midst of an extended trip this might be a real plus. CON: HOTEL ACCESS - When we first arrived, there was a game in progress. The street immediately in front of the hotel was blocked off with orange street cones. There was no obvious way to access the hotel. I circled the block three times before I finally ended up in an alley directly behind the hotel. Finally, I called the front desk with my cellphone. I told them what was going on. She instructed me to go back to the front where the cones were and she'd come out and meet me. I went there; she never did. Bottom line - with 81 home dates per year, I find it incomprehensible that this hotel hasn't done a better job of wayfinding for an arriving guest. CON: POOL HOURS - This may sound petty but the posted pool hours are only 5p-10p nightly. There is no explanation for this. And if you desire to walk the Inner Harbor in the evening, a common desire, you basically can't access the pool. Again, for folks going to a 7:00pm baseball game that pretty much means you won't be swimming. The pool itself is relatively small, in the basement, and without windows to the inside. Bottom line - my kids felt gypped that they couldn't swim because our itinerary often had us away during the unusually limited hours. CON: BREAKFAST SERVICE - The posted hours for a very nice complimentary breakfast served in the lobby was 6a-10a. I was traveling with two teen boys who like their sleep. When I arrived at 9:45am to get breakfast.... the cupboard was bare. Other guests told me that the woman in charge of this area had started breaking down the food service at 9:30am. No cereal, no fruit, no donuts.... just a few scraggly bagels.... Then, when we shared this information with the front desk the following day, we were told that we were mistaken and that breakfast had been avaible through 10am.... unbelievable.... we were there but couldn't trust our own eyes, I suppose. Bottom line - if you post breakfast hours, keep those hours fully available. CON: ROOM SECURITY - Now this may seem really petty but it was important to me. I specifically placed a "Do Not Disturb" sign on my door one morning. I was willing to forgo room service because I was doing some work and had a lot of my stuff out. I wanted to run an errand without securing all of my stuff. (I know... I know... not wise). Nevertheless, I did it. Imagine my surprise when I returned to find the sign ignored and my room done up. Now, I appreciate the maid's desire to "do her job" but... I fail to understand why she would have ignored my wishes. FINAL THOUGHT: Again, our vacation time was not "ruined" by any of the above and, ultimately, the location was terrific. I would advise others to shop around. There are other options; comparably priced.

Reviews.Title: “A pleaseant surprise”
Reviews.Author: cindi11764
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hampton Inn Baltimore at about midnight. We were refreshed to see that the doors were locked and that the bellman had to "buzz us in" (safety). The front desk was very friendly and professional. They even required an adult to give permission to allow food charges against the room (we had 2 teens with us). The decorations in the lobby were baseball related (across from Orioles stadium) but very modern ... really nice. The rooms were beautiful and comfortable. Flat screen TV's, comfortable bed and very nicely decorated. Each door had a unique photo next to it. Will visit again

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: CoachQ1116
